article.heading: Pronunciation
article.paragraph: InAncient Greek, delta represented avoiced dental plosiveIPA/d/. InModern Greek, it represents avoiced dental fricativeIPA/ð/, like the "th" in "that" or "this". It isromanization of Greekromanizedasdordh.

article.heading: Keyboard Entry
article.paragraph: OnMicrosoft Windows, a small delta can be generated by typingkey press[[Alt key|Alt]]2key press3key press5. In certain programs (e.g.Microsoft Word), an uppercase delta can be typed usingkey press[[Alt key|Alt]]0key press9key press1key press6. However, in most other programs,key press[[Alt key|Alt]]0key press9key press1key press6generates a closing quotation mark ().
OnOS X, option-j yields an upper-case delta ().
